thread.title: Wales Qualify For First Euro Championships
thread.title_full: Wales Qualify For First Euro Championships

title: Wales Qualify For First Euro Championships
text:
Switch to US Edition Wales Qualify For First Euro Championships Gareth Bale and his team end a 57-year wait to qualify for a major tournament and will make their debut at the Euros next year. 05:01, UK, Sunday 11 October 2015 Chris Coleman has led his side through an historic qualifying campaign Share by email Wales have qualified for a major tournament for the first time in more than 50 years despite losing 2-0 to Bosnia-Herzegovina. 
Chris Coleman's side needed one point to reach next year's European Championships - or for Israel not to beat Cyprus. 
It was the latter that saw them through, with Walsall's right-back Jason Demetriou scoring the winning goal in a 2-1 victory for Cyprus. The first Welsh side to qualify for a major tournament since the 1950s 
It is the first time Wales have qualified for a tournament of note since the 1958 World Cup - and it will be their first ever appearance at the Euros. 
Coleman said: "Wow - I can't explain to you how it feels. Unbelievable. It's been an absolute dream." 
Generations of talented Welsh footballers have famously been denied the opportunity to showcase their skills in international tournaments - but the world's most expensive footballer, Gareth Bale, is now set to feature in France next summer. Gareth Bale could be one of the stars of the tournament 
Bale said: "This is the best loss of my life! We've done it, everyone's very happy. 
"This is right up there (in my career) - this was one of my dreams of things to do. 
"Now we've got to go and get things done in France next summer." 
Wales join England and Northern Ireland in the tournament - and Republic of Ireland could follow on Sunday. Promoted Stories
